body_html:
I will point out there are LLVM IR emitters for Dot and Conv, e.g.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/cpu/dot_op_emitter.h
and IrEmitter::HandleConvolution in ir_emitter.h:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/cpu/ir_emitter.cc
They are reference implementations and not tuned for performance, which is why Eigen is used in practice. However, they may make a good starting point for something like Polly.

They are reference implementations and not tuned for performance, which is why Eigen is used in practice. However, they may make a good starting point for something like Polly.
body:
I will point out there are LLVM IR emitters for Dot and Conv, e.g.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/cpu/dot_op_emitter.h
and IrEmitter::HandleConvolution in ir_emitter.h:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/compiler/xla/service/cpu/ir_emitter.cc
They are reference implementations and not tuned for performance, which is why Eigen is used in practice. However, they may make a good starting point for something like Polly.
